head.title: Today, It's Art When You're a Somebody (Sorry, Aunt Millie)

hedline.hl1: Today, It's Art When You're a Somebody (Sorry, Aunt Millie)

block.p: Morley Safer's introduction to the "60 Minutes" segment "Yes . . . but Is It Art?" incorrectly attributed "There's a sucker born every minute," to P. T. Barnum (news article, Oct. 4). After 10 years' research, the historian Arthur Saxon conclusively determined that this phrase has been erroneously ascribed to Barnum ("P. T. Barnum, the Legend and the Man," Columbia University Press, 1989).

Morley Safer's introduction to the "60 Minutes" segment "Yes . . . but Is It Art?" incorrectly attributed "There's a sucker born every minute," to P. T. Barnum (news article, Oct. 4). After 10 years' research, the historian Arthur Saxon conclusively determined that this phrase has been erroneously ascribed to Barnum ("P. T. Barnum, the Legend and the Man," Columbia University Press, 1989).

We would not presume to guess what Barnum's opinion of the contemporary art scene might be, but we are certain that the "Prince of Humbug" would be amused by the controversy. LINDA A. ALTSHULER Exec. Dir., The Barnum Museum Bridgeport, Conn., Oct. 5, 1993
